item.title: Remodeling website
item.description:
This is my first post in the remodeled version of my website.

I had a few goals in this remodel:

  • Continue with pelican as a site generator
  • Use jupyter notebooks as a content source
  • Have a "nice" directory structure
  • Host on GitHub
  • Allow custom javascript for interactive demos

While these …
item.dc:creator: John Mahoney

item.title: K-Nearest Neighbors
item.description:
“If it walks near k other ducks, then it probably is a duck.”

Setup

Imagine there is a lake with lots of birds hanging around: ducks, geese, cranes, herons, and so on. We can see each bird clearly enough to tell what type it is.

Problem:

item.dc:creator: John Mahoney

item.title: Design your own hexaflexagon
item.description:
Hexaflexagons are strange, paper creatures made of origami and a sprinkle of magic.

"But it looks like a hexagonal coaster for my coffee..", you say, "what's cool about that?"

What's cool is that this coaster has three sides!

The nice image here is from wikimedia. You will find that there …

item.title: Notebook template
item.description:
Notes:

  • \(\LaTeX\): It renders correctly from the markdown file. The \(\LaTeX\) within the notebook markdown cells renders the equations, but not the inline math. TODO: fix this
  • When you reference a single cell, you can't say cells[4], you have to write cells[4:5].
  • The numbers in cells[m …

item.title: Define Functions Iteratively With Python
item.description: An interesting problem came up recently, there was a piece of code absolutely full of the same function calls over and over again, meaning if anything ever need to change, that would have to be changed in over 500 places, not ideal. Thoughts go back to single responsbility, and don't …
